snippet: The report said that budget-related hiring freezes left fewer people protecting the White House, and that the agency needed to fix “systemic mismanagement.”
abstract: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee releases report critical of Secret Service that finds agency is bedeviled by staffing crisis and low morale, factors that have led to persistent security breaches; report raises questions about how forthright agency's directors have been with Congress.
lead_paragraph: The report said that budget-related hiring freezes left fewer people protecting the White House, and that the agency needed to fix “systemic mismanagement.”

headline.main: Staffing Crisis Threatens Secret Service Mission, House Report Says
headline.print_headline: Staffing Crisis and Poor Morale Threaten Secret Service Mission, House Report Says
